Pre-Game Insights: Iceland comes into this game sitting in 3rd place in the group having picked up three points.
Wales comes into this game sitting 2nd place in the group having picked up four points.
Sverrir Ingi Ingason has returned to the team and he’s going to need to have a huge game here.
Alfons Sampsted and Willum Thor Willumsson are both looking to move into the starting lineup and they are going to need to be strong here.
Joe Allen was retired from international play but he’s back now and he’s going to need to have a strong game here.
David Brooks, Nathan Broadhead and Wes Burns have all been called up and they are going to need to be playmakers here.
